intro: Euryops triqueter, commonly known as the three-lobed sunflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. Its leaves are palmately lobed, giving it a distinctive appearance. Euryops triqueter is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
